I\'m warmed of mobile technologies. Ideas maker, curious and sports lover

AI is the technique of programming a computer to respond to data in the same way that an intelligent being does. It could be considered as a simulation of how an intelligent being reacts, processes and understands the data.
Data is the information sent, processed and analyzed by an AI system. The system then tries to discover the patterns or rules that govern the data.

An AI system is usually trained by feeding it lots of data and allowing it to discover patterns in the data. A trained model can use these rules to solve problems using data it hasn\'t seen before! For example, to train a machine to recognize shoes, thousands of images of different types of shoes would be used. The machine then learns to identify the "characteristics" common to the shoes and develops patterns or rules for recognizing the shoes.

Overfitting is a common occurrence in machine learning. One of the reasons it happens is when an AI system is trained using partial or insufficient data. The system works fine when asked to solve problems using the \"training\" data, but not when exposed to previously unseen data. For example, while training a machine to recognize shoes, if you only train it using images of hiking boots, the machine will work fine if it is asked to recognize a hiking boot it hasn\'t seen before, but it may malfunction if asked. shows a high heel.

Las imágenes se almacenan en una computadora como valores de píxeles. Una cuadrícula de números puede representar una imagen en escala de grises, donde cada celda de la cuadrícula representa un valor de píxel entre 0 y 255. Considere que una cuadrícula de 6x6 de valores de píxeles representa la siguiente imagen. Se pueden aplicar filtros a esta imagen para extraer líneas o bordes verticales.

Filters are smaller grids of numbers (in this case, a 3x3 grid). A filter is applied sequentially to 3x3 sections of the image grid. When a filter is applied, each value in the image grid is multiplied by the corresponding value in the filter. The resulting nine values are added together, and the resulting sum is the final value of a pixel in the filtered image. In this particular case, the initial 6x6 image results in a smaller image. This specific filter helps extract vertical edges. Note that the filtered image is easier to work with as it is smaller but has not lost any essential features. On the other hand, certain features are enhanced and help to recognize the content of the image.
This part of the application will allow you to load a dataset from the device\'s memory of type SVG and will be able to read its data and load it into the application.
The application will be able to perform each and every one of the operations based on the entered dataset, the entry of the variables, offering two ways to solve the training of the neuron.
The application is capable of calculating the results and is capable of capturing them and offers different ways of visualizing each and every one of the calculations made.
The application is capable of graphing the general result as well as being able to graph all the operations carried out within the same calculation.
